messages.content: What is the purpose of the Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct adopted by comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
The Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct adopted by comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock is a guideline for participating in the project's community.
Where can I find more information about the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
For more information about the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock, you can refer to the Code of Conduct FAQ at https://aws.github.io/code-of-conduct-faq.
Who can I contact if I have additional questions or comments about the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
If you have additional questions or comments about the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock, you can contact opensource-codeofconduct@amazon.com.
Is the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock specific to this project?
Yes, the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock is specific to this project and has been adopted from the Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct.
What is the importance of having a Code of Conduct for open source projects like comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
Having a Code of Conduct for open source projects like comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock helps maintain a positive and inclusive environment for all contributors and participants.
Does the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock apply to all contributors and participants?
Yes, the Code of Conduct for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock applies to all contributors and participants of the project.
Is the Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct a standard for all Amazon-related open source projects?
Yes, the Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct is a standard that has been adopted by comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock and other Amazon-related open source projects.
What should I do before submitting a pull request to contribute to comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?

Before submitting a pull request, ensure that you are working against the latest source on the *main* branch, check existing open and recently merged pull requests to avoid duplicating efforts, and open an issue to discuss any significant work to avoid wasting time.
What should I do when filing an issue for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?

When filing an issue, please try to include as much information as possible, such as a reproducible test case or series of steps, the version of the code being used, any modifications made relevant to the bug, and anything unusual about your environment or deployment.
What is the process for sending a pull request to comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?

To send a pull request, fork the repository, modify the source focusing on the specific change, ensure local tests pass, commit to your fork using clear commit messages, send the pull request answering any default questions, and pay attention to any automated CI failures reported, staying involved in the conversation.
Where can I find contributions to work on for comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
Looking at existing issues, especially those labeled 'help wanted', is a great way to find something to contribute to comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock.
What is the Code of Conduct for contributing to comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?

The comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock project has adopted the Amazon Open Source Code of Conduct. For more information, see the Code of Conduct FAQ or contact opensource-codeofconduct@amazon.com with any additional questions or comments.
What should I do if I discover a potential security issue in comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?
If you discover a potential security issue, notify AWS/Amazon Security via the vulnerability reporting page. Do not create a public GitHub issue.
What is the licensing for the comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock project?
The licensing for the comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock project can be found in the LICENSE file. Contributors will be asked to confirm the licensing of their contribution.
What is the purpose of the comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock repository?
The comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock repository provides ComfyUI nodes for Amazon Bedrock service, allowing users to invoke foundation models in their ComfyUI pipeline.
What is the easiest way to deploy ComfyUI on Amazon SageMaker?
The easiest way to deploy ComfyUI on Amazon SageMaker is by using the CloudFormation template provided in the repository (comfyui_on_sagemaker.yaml).
Which models are currently supported by the comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock?

The comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock supports models from Anthropic (Claude 1.x, 2.0, 2.1, haiku, sonnet, opus, and Claude Instant 1.x), Amazon (Titan Image Generator G1 1.x), and Stability AI (Stable Diffusion XL 1.0).
How can users ensure access to Bedrock models is granted?
Users need to go to the AWS console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/home#/modelaccess) and make sure the required models are checked.
What are the two methods for configuring credentials to access Bedrock services?
The two methods for configuring credentials to access Bedrock services are using IAM roles and using AccessKeySecretKey (AKSK).
What is the default location of the AWS credentials file?
The default location of the AWS credentials file is ~/.aws/credentials.
What is the license for the comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock library?
The comfyui-llm-node-for-amazon-bedrock library is licensed under the MIT-0 License.
